metadata.title: CVE-2016-5387 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Apache HTTP Server through 2.4.23 follows RFC 3875 section 4.1.18 andtherefore does not protect applications from the presence of untrustedclient data in the HTTP_PROXY environment variable, which might allowremote attackers to redirect an application's outbound HTTP traffic to anarbitrary proxy server via a crafted Proxy header in an HTTP request, akaan "httpoxy" issue.  NOTE: the vendor states "This mitigation has beenassigned the identifier CVE-2016-5387"; in other words, this is not a CVEID for a vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1').
